title: Low Oil Pressure Warning Light Switch - Removal

body.body: Low Oil Pressure Warning Light Switch - Removal
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Warning - General - Prolonged or repeated contact with engine oil

Prolonged or repeated contact with engine oil can lead to skin dryness, irritation and dermatitis. In addition, used engine oil contains potentially harmful contamination which can cause cancer. Wear suitable clothing and avoid skin contact.
The engine oil and filter must be replaced in accordance with scheduled maintenance requirements.
Caution - General - Do not pour engine oil - pollution
Do not pour engine oil on the ground, down sewers or drains, or into watercourses. To prevent pollution of watercourses etc., dispose of used oil sensibly. If in doubt contact your local authority.
The low oil pressure warning light switch is located in the lower crankcase, behind the sprocket cover.
Battery Disconnect DV; DVX; DVY; DW; DW4; DX4; DWB; DVB

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DWB; DVB; DVY; DX4; DW4; DW; DVX; DV

body.body: Remove the lock nuts and detach the coolant expansion tank from its mounting. Discard the lock nuts.
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Remove the lock nut and detach the rear master cylinder reservoir from the coolant expansion tank mounting plate and position aside.
Secure the rear brake fluid reservoir in an upright position.
Release the fixings and remove the coolant expansion tank mounting.
Rear master cylinder reservoir lock nut
Disconnect the oil pressure switch electrical connector.
A small amount of oil will drain from the oil gallery when the switch is removed.
Position a suitable receptacle to collect any displaced oil from the oil gallery.
Remove the switch and discard the sealing washer.
